collisions

Class Collision

  • java.lang.Object
    • collisions.Collision

  • public class Collision
extends java.lang.Object

    A Collision models a collision between two objects with the given masses, velocities, and positions (center of mass). The getBounceVector method assumes one moving circle is colliding with a fixed circle, so it just returns the vector (dx, dy) of the moving circle after the bounce as a Point2D object.

    Example Usage for moving circle colliding with a fixed circle

    // dx is the horizontal velocity of the moving circle that should bounce
// dy is the vertical velocity of the moving circle that should bounce
// mx is the x-coordinate of the center of the moving circle
// my is the y-coordinate of the center of the moving circle
// fx is the x-coordinate of the center of the fixed circle
// fy is the y-coordinate of the center of the fixed circle
Point2D bounceVector = Collision.getBounceVector(new Point2D(dx, dy), new Point2D(mx, my), new Point2D(fx, fy));
double bounceDx = bounceVector.getX();
double bounceDy = bounceVector.getY();
    Version:
    5/21/2022
    Author:
    Ted_McLeod

      • Collision

        public Collision(double m1,
                 javafx.geometry.Point2D v1,
                 javafx.geometry.Point2D p1,
                 double m2,
                 javafx.geometry.Point2D v2,
                 javafx.geometry.Point2D p2)
        Initialize a collision between two circles with the given masses, velocities, and positions.
        Parameters:
        m1 - the mass of the first circle
        v1 - the velocity of the first circle (dx, dy)
        p1 - the position of the center of the first circle (centerX, centerY)
        m2 - the mass of the second circle
        v2 - the velocity of the second circle (dx, dy)
        p2 - the position of the center of the second circle (centerX, centerY)

      • getBounceVector

        public static javafx.geometry.Point2D getBounceVector(javafx.geometry.Point2D v1,
                                                      javafx.geometry.Point2D p1,
                                                      javafx.geometry.Point2D p2)
        returns the velocity of a circle after bouncing off another circle that is locked in position.
        Parameters:
        v1 - the velocity of the moving circle (dx, dy)
        p1 - the position of the center of the moving circle (centerX, centerY)
        p2 - the position of the center of the fixed position circle (centerX, centerY)
        Returns:
        the velocity of the circle after the collision (dx, dy)
